www.lawcommission.gov.np  
1 
 National Inclusion Commission Act, 2074 (2017)  
Date of Authentication and Publication:                                            
October 13 , 2017 ( 2074.06.27 )  
Amending Acts:  
The Act Amending Some Nepal Acts 2019  (2075)     March 3 , 2019 ( 2075.11.19 ) 
 
Act No. 18 of the year 2017  (2074)  
An Act m ade to make arrangements relating to National Inclusion 
Commission  
 
Preamble:  Whereas, it is expedient to make necessary arrangements relating 
to National Inclusion  Commission for the protection and promotion of the 
rights and interests of the communities including Khas  Arya, backward class, 
persons with disabilities, senior citizens, laborers, farmers, minorities and 
marginalized communities, people of Karnali, back ward areas and 
economically indigent class  and the empowerment of such communities,  
Now, therefore, be it enacted by the Federal Parliament pursuant to 
Article 296 sub -article (1) of the Constitution of Nepal.  
 
Chapter -1 
Preliminary  
 
1. Short title and Commencement : (1) This Act may be called "National 
Inclusion  Commission Act, 2017  (2074)."  
  (2)  This act shall come into force immediately.

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
2 
 2. Definitions : Unless the subject or the context otherwise requires, in this 
Act, -  
(a)  "Chairperson" means the Chairperson of the Commission 
 and the word also includes the member working as the 
 Acting Chairperson.  
(b)  "Commission" means the National Inclusion Commission 
 established under Article 258 of the Constitution.  
(c)  "Karnali" means the  then Karnali Zone.  
(d)  "Prescribed" or "As prescribed" means laws prescribed or 
 as prescribed under the Rules framed under this Act.  
(e)  "Backward Area" means the community as defined by the 
 Government of Nepal on the basis of the recommendation 
 made by the Commission.  
(f)  "Member" means the member of the Commission and the 
 word also includes the Chairperson.  
(g)  "Constitution" means the Constitution of Nepal.  
 
Chapter -2 
Power, Functions and Duties of the Commission  
 
3. Power, Functions and Duties of th e Commission : The power, 
function and duties of the Commission in addition to the power, 
function and duties of the Commission prescribed in Article 259  of the 
Constitution shall be as follows: -  
(a)  to review, monitor and evaluate the policy and programs 
 related with the Khas  Arya , backward class , persons with

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
3 
  disabilities, senior citizens, labor s, farmers, minorities as 
 well as marginalized communities  and backward class , 
 people of Karnali, backward areas  and economically 
 indigent class,  
(b)  to monitor or cause to monitor  the implementation of 
 the recommendation s made  or suggestions given by the 
 Commission,  
(c)  to formulate special programs for the development and 
 empowerment of the economically or socially 
 indigent people within the communities, class and region 
 mentioned  in Clause (a) and to make recommendations to 
 the Government of Nepal for their  implementation , 
(d)  to conduct study  and research into the language, script, 
 culture, history, tradition, literature, art of the 
 communities, class and  region mention ed in Clause (a) and  
 to formulate programs for the protection and development 
 of such language, script, culture, history, tradition, 
 literature, art and to make recommendation s to the 
 Government of Nepal for their implementation,   
(e)  to conduct awareness generating program for the 
 protection and promotion of the rights and interests of the 
 communities, class and region mention ed in Clause (a)  and 
 the empowerment of such  class and communities,  
(f)  to formulate program s to end all forms of exploitation 
 prevailing in  the communities, class and regions

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
4 
  mention ed in Clause (a) and to make recommendat ions to 
 the Government of Nepal for their implementation,   
(g)   to monitor the implementation of the international treaties, 
 agreements relating to the the class, regions and 
 communities mention ed in Clause (a)  that Nepal is  a party 
 to, and to make recommendations or suggestions for their  
 implementation to the Government of Nepal , 
(h) to collect complaints against the persons or organizations 
that violate the rights of the class, regions and communities 
mention ed in Clause (a) and to make recommendation to  
the concerned agency to conduct investigation  and 
prosecution over such complaints , 
(i)  to identify the class, regions and communities stated  
 mention ed in Clause (a) , by means of detailed study  and 
 research and to make recommendations to the Government 
 of Nepal to make lists of Surnames,  
(j)  to coordinate with the Government of Nepal and other 
 institutions and organizations with  relation to the policies, 
 program and decisions taken regarding the class, regions 
 and communities mention ed in Clause (a) , 
(k)  to formulate and implement the code of conduct for the 
 Chairperson, Members and employees of the Commission,  
                                                           
  Amended by The A ct Amending Some Nepal Acts  2019  (2075)

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
5 
 (l)  to approve the annual plans and program of the 
 Commission.  
4. May obtain opinion and consultations : The Commission, with relation 
to its functions and duties,  may receive opinions and seek consultations 
from any constitutional organ, government office or public entity.  
5. May obtain service of experts : The Commission may receive services 
from experts, pursuant to the federal law by stating the reasons thereof, 
if the human resource employed within the Commission is unable to  
perform any work that the Commission is required to perform as per the 
Constitution, this Act and prevailing federal law.  
6. May form  committee or working group : (1) The Commission may 
form a committee or working group to perform specific tasks  relating 
to the Commission,  by formulating a procedure.  
(2) The terms or scope of operation of the committee or working 
group formed pursuant to sub -section  (1), shall be as prescribed by the 
Commission at the time of its formation.  
(3) While forming the committee or working group pursuant to 
sub-section  (1), there shall be representation based on the principle of 
proportional representation, as enshrined in the Constitution.  
7.  Coordination and Coopera tion: The Commission may on the basis 
of necessity, coordinate and cooperate with government agencies or 
public entities.

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
6 
 Chapter - 3 
Operation of the Commission  
 
8.  Office of the Commission : (1) A central office of the Comm ission shall be 
established in the Kathmandu Valley for the operation of work of the 
Commission.  
(2) The Commission may, on the basis of necessity, establish offices 
in the provinces.  
9. Meeting of the Commission : (1) The meeting of the Commission shall 
decide the activities to be performed in accordance  with the Constitution 
and this Act.  
 (2) The meeting of the Commission shall be held on such a date, time 
and venue as prescribed by the Chairperson, based on necessity.  
  (3) The Secretary of the Commission shall  finalize and noti fy all 
members of the date, time and venue of the meeting along with a list of the 
agenda to be discussed in the meeting, at least 48 hours prior to the meeting .  
 (4) Any member interested to discuss additional issues, not included 
within the list of agen da set to be discussed within the meeting pursuant to 
sub-section (3),  shall notify the S ecretary of the additional issue and reason 
for their introduction to the meeting 24 hours prior to the meeting. Upon 
receipt of such information, the S ecretary of the Commission shall notify 
all members and such issue shall be considered to have been included in the 
list.

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
7 
  (5) Notwithstanding anything stated in sub -sections (3) and (4), an 
issue not included within the list may be introduced and decided  by the 
Commission, with the agreement of all members present in the meeting.  
 (6) The quorum of the meeting shall be deemed to have been fulfilled 
with the presence of more than 50 percent of the immediate members of the 
Commission.  
 (7) The meeting of t he Commission shall be chaired by the 
Chairperson of the Commission.  
 (8) The decision of the majority shall be the decision of the 
Commis sion and in case of a tie, the C hairperson shall give a decisive vote.  
 (9) The Secretary of the Commission shall cr eate a depository of  the 
decision of the Commission, authenticating  it with the signatures of the 
Chairperson and Members.  
  (10) The Secretary of the Commission shall be a gazetted first class 
officer of the Nepal Civil Service. The seniormost official of the 
Commission shall act as the Secretary of the Commission until the 
appointment of such official.  
 (11) Other procedures related to the meeting of the Commission shall 
be as determined by the Commission.  
10.  Not to take part in the decision making in case of conflict of interest :  
If any member of the Commission has any interest, concern or benefit  
arising from any issue under consideration in the Commission or if the near 
                                                           
  Amended by The A ct Amending Some Nepal Acts 2019  (2075)

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
8 
 relatives of such persons stand to benefit directly or indirectly, such 
membe r should give prior information to the Commission regarding such 
matters and such member shall not take part in the decision making process 
of the Commission concerning such matters.  
11.  Work Division : The division of the work of the Chairperson and Memb er 
shall be as fixed by the Commission.  
12.  Work to be performed as an acting : The senior most Member of the 
Commission, shall work as the acting Chairperson,  if the position of the 
Chairperson falls vacant due to any reason, is unable to perform work 
pursuant to sub -article (6) of Article 101 of the constitution, has gone for a 
foreign visit or is on leave for more than 7 days.   
13.  Work, performance of the Commission not to be interrupted : The 
vacancy of post of the Chairperson  and/or any Member shall  not interrupt 
the works of the Commission.  
  .................  
Chapter -4 
Miscellaneous  
 
14.  Organizational Structure and Employees of the Commission : (1) The 
organizational structure and appointment of employees of the Commission 
shall be as approve d by the Government of Nepal.  
                                                           
  Amended by The A ct Amending Some Nepal Acts 2019  (2075)  
  Removed by The A ct Amending Some Nepal Acts 2019  (2075)

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
9 
  (2) The Government of Nepal shall make available the employees 
necessary for the Commission to perform its work.  
15.  Duties and Conduct of Post:  (1) The duties and conduct of the post to be 
adhered by the Chairperson and Member s of the Commission shall be as 
follows:  
(a) to perform the obligations of the post independently, 
impartially and honestly for the protect ion and 
promotion of  the rights, interests of the  Khas  Arya, 
backward class , persons with disabilities, se nior 
citizens, labors, farmers, minorities as well as 
marginalized communities and backward class, 
people of Karnali and economically indigent class  
and empowerment of such class and community,  
(b)  not to commit any act that would create discord in the 
relationship between different ethnicities, communities 
and identities.  
 (2) The Chairperson and the Members of the Commission shall 
adhere to the code of conduct as prescribed by this Act or prevailing federal 
laws.  
16.  Cooperation to be extended : It shall be the duty of any agency or official 
with which the Commission seeks assistance, to cooperate with the 
Commission in course of the performance of its functions.   
17.  Power to send for implementation in writing : If the Commission finds 
that any agency or official has not made available necessary assistance to

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
10 
 the Commission, it may write to the higher agency or official , above such 
agency or official for assistance in the matter.  
18.  Annual report : The Commission shall submit an annual report  of the work 
and activities of the Commission  to the President, within three months of 
the date of expiry of the fiscal year.  
   (2) The report made pursuant to sub -section (1), shall inter -alia, 
include the following matters, in addition to other details:  
(a) Details of implementation of annual programs of the  
  Commission and expenses incurred,  
(b) Details of suggestions, recommendations given by the 
Commission to Nepal Government or any other agency ,  
(c) The status of the implementation of the suggestions, 
recommendations given in accordance to clause (c),   
(d) Situation of physical and economic resources of the 
Commission and their utilization,  
(e) Details of other activities performed by the Commission in 
course  of fulfilling the  responsibilities required of the 
Commission , pursuant to this Act.  
19.  Liaison with Government of Nepal : The Ministry of Federal Affairs and 
General Administration  and shall liaise the Commission with the 
Government of Nepal.  
                                                           
  Amended by The A ct Amending Some Nepal Acts 2019  (2075)

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
11 
 20.  Delegation of Power : The Commission may delegate some a uthority 
 accorded to it by the Constitution and this Act, as per necessity, with set 
 conditions for  its use and adherence, to  the Chairperson, Member, 
 Government of Nepal, State Go vernment, officia l employee of any agency 
 or Local Government.  
 
21. ...................  
 
22. Protection of the action taken in Good Faith : No legal proceedings 
 shall be initiated against the Members of the Commission, employees or 
 any person deputed by the Commission for any action performed under 
 this Act or rules framed under this Act, in good faith.  
23. Power to frame rules : (1) The Commission may frame necessary rules for 
the implementation of this Act.  
 (2) The Commission sha ll have to get the approval of the 
Government of Nepal, Ministry of Finance , while making rules pursuant 
to subsection (1), on matters that impose financial burden or liability to  the 
Government of Nepal.  
 (3) The rules made pursuant to sub -section (1) shall come into force, 
from the date of publication in the Nepal Gazette.  
                                                           
  Removed by The A ct Amending Some Nepal Acts 2019  (2075)

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
12 
 24.  Power to frame Directives : The Commission may, subject to this Act or 
rules framed under this Act, issue directives to conduct  or cause to conduct 
the smooth operation of its functions . 
 
 
                                                           
  Amended by The A ct Amending Some Nepal Acts 2019  (2075)

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
13
